summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no information available about Robert C. Petersen. The documents primarily focus on local agency checks conducted on Manuel Marti and his siblings, Ivan and Blanca Marti, by the FBI in San Juan, Puerto Rico. These checks were conducted in October 1968 and aimed to gather information on Manuel Marti, including his aliases and any records associated with him. Robert C. Petersen is not mentioned in any of the document summaries provided.
significance: Based on the provided documents, Robert C. Petersen's significance in the JFK context cannot be determined as he is not mentioned in the summaries.
